admreg: Europe and Central Asia,Europe and Central Asia

abstracts.cdata!:
The assessment of the project is judged
            unsatisfactory. Although the project met the objectives of
            eliminating discharge of untreated sewage, thus increasing
            the population served by the main sewer pipes, and reducing
            flooding, Ankara Water and Sewerage Administration's
            (ASKI) failures, particularly, compliance with the
            Loan's tariff provisions, hindered success.
            Nevertheless, ASKIs management succeeded recently with
            constructive measures, and the likelihood of improving its
            income is predictable. The Bank's performance was
            inadequate in project preparation, offering no viable
            solutions to problems identified during this stage; in
            addition, appraisal results failed to properly assess
            ASKI's financial capabilities. The lessons learned
            convey that, it is paramount to define clear and consistent
            objectives, particularly upon sector changes. Early
            understanding of these objectives, by all stakeholders, as
            well as the causes for the borrower's problems, should
            be emphasized. Project design should isolate the utilities
            from inadequate political interference, and instead, enhance
            managerial capabilities. Premature decisions on project
            implementation could be detrimental, particularly, when
            procurement disagreements need to be resolved. The project
            outcome questions the merits of financial covenants, in
            light of the authority failure, by the implementing agency,
            to assure full compliance.
